General course objectives:
General course objectives
To enable the students to assess erosion and sedimentation problems in relation to engineering projects in rivers and along coasts
Content: Basic concepts: critical bed shear stress, bed load transport and suspended load transport in current and in waves. Bed forms (dunes and sand waves) and their significance for the flow resistance and sediment transport. Large scale morphology in rivers (meandering and braiding). Long- and cross-shore wave-induced currents. Sediment transport along coasts. Coastal morphology (bars, rip channels, coastline development).
Course literature: Fredsøe, J. and Deigaard, R. (1992) Mechanics of Coastal Sediment Transport. World Scientific. https://doi.org/10.1142/1546
